name: places/ChIJuz12C5hZwokRZAJnjK9kI1E
formattedAddress: 145 E 27th St # 1G, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 145 E 27th St # 1G, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
We booked an initial session a week in advance. 20 minutes before our session, she emailed me that she needed me to send her a Google Meets invite, so she would have it on her calendar. While I thought it was strange that it would be my responsibility (as the patient), and not hers, to manage her calendar, I obliged and sent the link.

Dr. Ilani did not show up to the session, left me waiting for 45 minutes, and made no attempt to apologize, reschedule, or contact me at all.

If you are looking for a therapist, I suggest you look elsewhere for a provider that does not waste their clients' time.

originalText.text: Dr. Ilani helped me navigate a difficult time and major life transition. She truly cares and was able to get me to see things in a new light.  It ended up unlocking the most positive experiences of my life and am extremely grateful!

text.text: Dr. Ilani helped me navigate a difficult time and major life transition. She truly cares and was able to get me to see things in a new light.  It ended up unlocking the most positive experiences of my life and am extremely grateful!

originalText.text: First and foremost, Dr. Ilani is an excellent therapist who helped me manage my anxieties and find solutions for any issues I was experiencing. With that said, her ability to set and keep appointments was very poor. She double-booked more than once and her communication via text and email was inconsistent.

text.text: First and foremost, Dr. Ilani is an excellent therapist who helped me manage my anxieties and find solutions for any issues I was experiencing. With that said, her ability to set and keep appointments was very poor. She double-booked more than once and her communication via text and email was inconsistent.

originalText.text:
Horrible. I do not know how she has a license. First visit she LAUGHED when I mentioned my sadness about my pet rabbit dying. That should have sent me running. But it was so hard to find a provider accepting my insurance. Later in in my “treatment”, I had been suffering from debilitating back pain, and she basically yelled at me saying how she had been pregnant with kids and was basically crawling on the floor with back pain, but she did what she had to do. Then she said, “If this (my back pain) is psychosomatic, it’s going to last a very long time.”
She said this to a delicate patient. Who could potentially be very highly susceptible to suggestion. Leaving me scared that this was “in my head” and was NOT  going away. When I confronted her about it she flat out DENIED that she ever said it. When I asked her why she would not admit it, she said it was because of her “reputation “. She had ZERO concern for what her ignorant comment did to a fragile suffering patient. Cared only about her rude, ignorant self. So much for “do no harm.”
Stay away. And I noticed she gave herself a 5 star review! Haha oh my! Give it up, lady.

originalText.text: Wildly unprofessional.  On top of recommending unorthodox (read: illegal) means for dealing with problems, she was regularly late to appointments and even failed to show up to an appointment.  When called, emailed, and texted about the missed appointment, she didn't even have the common courtesy or decency to respond.  I had to seek out a new therapist and start from scratch: time and money wasted here.
